DataElement.preferredName: mHCCQ for Breast Cancer Treatment 4 Feel that Physician Listened to how I would Like to Handle Breast Cancer Treatment Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation about whether they feel that their physician listened to how they would like to handle their breast cancer treatment, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Modified Health Care Climate Questionnaire for Breast Cancer Treatment Feel that Physician Listened to how I would Like to Handle Breast Cancer Treatment Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A shortened version of the Health Care Climate Questionnaire (HCCQ) adapted for breast cancer patients. It uses 6 questions and a 7-point Likert scale to measure the patient?s perception of their physician?s support for patient autonomy._A question about whether an individual feels or felt that their physician listened to how they would like to handle their breast cancer treatment._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Modified Health Care Climate Questionnaire for Breast Cancer Treatment
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A shortened version of the Health Care Climate Questionnaire (HCCQ) adapted for breast cancer patients. It uses 6 questions and a 7-point Likert scale to measure the patient's perception of their physician's support for patient autonomy.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: mHCCQ (Modified Health Care Climate Questionnaire for Breast Cancer)

ReferenceDocuments.name: I feel that my physician list
ReferenceDocuments.description: I feel that my physician listened to how I would like to handle my breast cancer treatment.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Modified Health Care Climate Questionnaire for Breast Cancer Treatment (mHCCQ)
